p: Representatives of exopolysaccharides (EPS) producing strains of the genera Streptococcus, Lactococcus, Lactobacillus, Leuconostoc, Pediococcus, and Weissella have been well studied for immunostimulating properties. The EPSs extracted from lactic acid bacteria of the genera Pediococcus, Leuconostoc, and Lactobacillus significantly proved to produce anti-adenovirus effects in cell line studies ( Biliavska et al., 2019). Other microbial metabolites like spongouridine, spongothymidine, statins, myriocin, NA255, and cyclosporine were reported to have antiviral activities against HSV1,2, HBV, HIV, influenza virus, HCV, and coronaviruses ( Nkongolo et al., 2014). Antiviral attributes of bacteria associated bioactive compounds are summarized in Table 5 .
